channel.title: Play private server offline?
channel.description:
Hello all of you,
I've got a Yes/No-question of which I think the answer will probably be no.
If I download a private server from runelocus, (I downloaded Skylarscape), is it possible to play it on your own computer just for fun without being connected to the server? Or do you need the source to do that? I just want to do this because I wanna get to know the drops and stuff and the server isn't 24/7 :-(.
Thanks for reading, I hope some of you can take the time to reply :-).
Peace

item.title: Play private server offline?
item.dc:creator: @Doobage Doobage
item.description:
@Doobage wrote:

thedanny1993:

does anyone have the source for skylar scape it was ownage i was sinner738 if u played… so any one got the source… if so really helpfull… im not leeeching just wanna play it for fun

I never released MY SOURCE FOR SKYLARSCAPE. and i will never.

[OFFTOPIC]:

Server is back up.

Read full topic

item.title: Play private server offline?
item.dc:creator: @denbruno denbruno
item.description:
@denbruno wrote:

I’ve done that but it doesn’t work. Could it be that it’s a problem with my router? I’m using wireless internet of Netgear, and I’ve read that the firewall can sometimes cause problems for this. I can’t log in with normal moparscape client either. It says my account is already logged in :s.
This is such a difficult situation :o.

Edit:

Do I need a portforwarding or something? I found how to add it but what should the service name (Age-Of-Empire HTTP,…) and server IP address be then?

Read full topic

item.title: Play private server offline?
item.dc:creator: @The_Unholy The Unholy
item.description:
@The_Unholy wrote:

search for skylarscape’s IP in client.java, gui.java or egui.java and change them all… It may not have gui or egui.

Read full topic

item.title: Play private server offline?
item.dc:creator: @denbruno denbruno
item.description:
@denbruno wrote:

Thanks for helping!

So I got the folder of the server I downloaded, but I can’t find where to change the ip, it’s not in the the provided client’s buttons :-(. Is there something essential I forgot? It’s quite a weird file actually, I posted some screens :-).



Where should I look? I’m sorry I’m so bad at this…

Edit:

Ok, I’ve been googling for a while and I found that you should change the server’s ip ‘skylarscape.no-ip.org’ to 127.0.0.1
I did so but that didn’t work, so I tried my own ip adress but that didn’t work either… I think I’m doing something wrong or don’t have program or something running :(. Maybe that no-ip program I’ve read about when you want to create your own server…

Can anyone help me?

Read full topic

item.title: Play private server offline?
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Search your client for the ip that will parse your connection and allow you to connect. Your localhost is 127.0.0.1 so replace it with that.

Read full topic

item.title: Play private server offline?
item.dc:creator: @pzykow pzykow
item.description:
@pzykow wrote:

You can, make sure you change IP to 127.0.0.1 + make sure you have client and server.

Read full topic
